attributes.action: A life-time ban from politics, and punishment, for MPs that renege on promises.
attributes.background: We propose a life ban from politics for MPs who do not enact all manifesto promises - or those implied in slogans.  Also a fine or imprisonment for 'perjury to abuse public trust'. Party funds used for such campaigns should be forcibly recovered to fund a watchdog body against future such abuses.
attributes.additional_details: Whatever you voted, the decision to leave the EU is a chance for Britain to fix its democracy.  In elections, and now in the referendum, politicians make campaign promises in order to win votes, only to u-turn or deny making those promises. It mocks the principles of democracy. Now is a chance to write into law an insurance against such deception. This law would put an end to 'career politics' and remind all elected representatives that they work for the electorate, not their own agendas.

attributes.action: Europeans in the UK for more than 10 years should be given British citizenship.
attributes.background:
We need to demonstrate that leaving the EU will not develop xenophobic reteric in the country,which can not be controlled.
There are lots of Europeans who are keeping this country running, in the health services and caring professions who are scared they will be kicked out due to the result.

attributes.action:
Brighton out of Britain.
Give Brighton and Hove its independence from Britain.
attributes.background: Brighton and Hove has long been a liberal land at odds with the country it resides in. This has been shown many times in our recent voting past. This has now again been highlighted in the recent brexit vote. We want to remain in Europe and continue to thrive in a time of globalisation.

attributes.action: Remove the titles Mrs, Miss and Ms from all government forms.
attributes.background: Titles for women are sexist and discriminatory, and provide marital status information about them that men do not have to divulge. Even having the Ms option gives some people a preconception about that person. All titles fields should be removed from document and computer forms.

attributes.action: Property buyers must be British citizens, not corporations or overseas investors
attributes.background: In a time that overpopulation and immigration are hot topics, we need to use the space we have to accommodate the people that make Britain great. In order for this to happen, we need to stop properties being able to be bought by anonymous foreign investors for their own economic gain.
attributes.additional_details: Over £120bn of British properties are owned by offshore companies, who don't pay the same taxes as us to the government, and often don't occupy the housing they own. The Standard revealed investors had bought at least £100 billion of property in the capital using overseas companies. The Land Registry figures also show that in just one deal signed off by Boris Johnson in 2011, at Riverlight Quay in the Nine Elms regeneration area, 15% of the homes sold so far have been bought by foreign firms.

attributes.action: If Asia Bibi is executed we should 'cease trading' with Pakistan immediately.
attributes.background: Asia Bibi, a Christian, offered water to a Muslim woman. She refused as it had been handled by a 'dirty animal and dirty Christian'. She was found guilty of blasphemy and sentenced to death because she said 'Jesus may have a different viewpoint to Mohammed'.
attributes.additional_details: Daily Express 1 June 2016. Asia Bibi offered water to a Muslim woman who “I said ‘I think Jesus would have a different viewpoint to Mohammed’, the woman said ‘how dare you question the prophet, dirty animal’ and a 'dirty Christian'. She was found guilty by a Pakistan court of blasphemy and sentenced to death.This, by inference, is saying all Christians including our Queen as Head of Commonwealth and also Church of England is also. STOP trading, giving AID and eject from Commonwealth.

attributes.action: Make councils turn redundant grace space they own into wildflower meadows.
attributes.background: Councils own lot's of patches of land next to roads, buildings  on housing estates etc; all that grows there is grass; it looks boring and the councils probably spend a fortune cutting the grass in the warmer months. Meadows are decreasing they need some help.

attributes.action: Make a commitment to create a British space elevator (not just a space port).
attributes.background: If we truly want to get in to the space race we need to make a bold move. A space elevator would allow for cheap transport into orbit. The material science is close. We have a possible site in the Ascension Islands and we should take the initiative for once. The commercial possibilities are endless
attributes.additional_details:
Space Elevators in Science Fiction, also see Beanstalks

http://www.extremetech.com/extreme/176625-60000-miles-up-geostationary-space-elevator-could-be-built-by-2035-says-new-study

BBC, Wikipedia

attributes.action: Raise the Speed limit on Motorways in the UK from 70mph to 90mph.
attributes.background: The 70mph speed limit on UK motorways was introduced in 1966. since then the technology and safety features of cars has come on considerably. it is now time to embrace this change and accept that it is safe for cars to drive at this speed. it will also help to reduce congestion on motorways.

attributes.action: To grant leave to remain in the UK for my wife whom I'm married for 26 years.
attributes.background: I married to my wife a Singapore citizen for 26 years and have two children born in the UK and I am a UK citizen, we submitted many application over 18 years for Visa for my wife to remain in the UK but all was rejected(6 in all)After many tries and different forms the application is rejected again.
attributes.additional_details: I have medical problems and had two operations in 3 months and need someone to look after me and also suffering from depression.I have wasted most of my savings paying for the applications and recent application had to be submitted with medical insurance and the price has gone up for new applications.My family life has been ruined because of this and my kids grew up not knowing their mother well.We have a grandchild who was born April of this year.We have a right to be together.

attributes.action: Make Philosophy a mandatory subject to be taught throughout a child's education.
attributes.background: Philosophy provides a lifetime of vital skills in reasoning and critical thought. Children will learn how to make logical arguments and spot fallacies, to question accepted truths, and to discuss the nature of reality and ethics. It will be beneficial to the individual and to society as a whole.
attributes.additional_details:
Teaching philosophy to primary school children can improve their English and maths skills, according to a pilot study highlighting the value of training pupils to have inquiring minds. (From http://www.independent.co.uk)

“If we leave questioning the models children have been taught until later in life, it could be too late," warns Professor Angie Hobbs. "That is why we need to start teaching philosophy in primary school.” (From http://www.telegraph.co.uk)

attributes.action: change the law of dogs on public footpaths and open land to no dogs allowed.
attributes.background: due to increasing livestock attacks due to dogs and a outdated law which can never be enforced if the police have no evidence then no action can be taken against the owners of the dog if they can be found...which in turn causes tens of thousands of damage to livestock and wildlife.
attributes.additional_details: its a well known fact the British news media does not report the real accounts of how many dog attacks there is on livestock / wildlife, but on other media sites it's widespread ..farming forums farming press you tube  etc ...but not everyone reads this media ..this law needs rewritten to which if there is no  written permission given for dogs allowed on a public path /open land then no dogs allowed ..

attributes.action: Commit to improve transgender healthcare in the UK
attributes.background:
In July 2016, I polled 100 transgender people and 60% reported their experience at a gender identity clinic (GIC) was detrimental to their mental health. 

The process of proving the validity of your gender in order to receive treatment harms individuals and it must be changed.
attributes.additional_details:
Full survey found on Beyond the Binary. While GICs are currently working towards reducing waiting times, the entire process is broken.

By signing this petition, we are asking the government to:

- Pledge more funds towards trans health care to address admin problems.
- Prioritise the work of the Equalities Office to address the harm that GICs are doing.
- Anything else that can be done to address the lack of NICE guidelines for treating gender dysphoria and means of treatment.

attributes.action: Make care for teenagers/young adults with disabilities free for working parents.
attributes.background: As a continually working parent of a child with a disability, it is impossible to find child care for my son either reasonably priced or even available. Unless I have a family member to look after my son outwith school hours I cannot work. Let's make this care available and free for working parents.

attributes.action: Invoke NATO Article 4 consultation on establishing a "No-Fly" zone over Syria.
attributes.background: Syrian and Russian airstrikes target civilian population centres, schools and medical centres, weaponising refugees and making living in non government areas untenable. This not only constitutes a warcrime but effectively endangers NATO and EU cohesion, as a planned and desired secondary objective.
attributes.additional_details:
A "No-Fly" zone would force the Syrian and Russian regime to take the peace talks seriously, stop the scheduled and intentional murder of innocent civilians and allow for the implementation of much needed humanitarian aid. It would also be an effective first step in allowing Syrian refugees to return home.

Secondly we respectfully request that her Majesty's government petition the International Tribunal in the Hague to prosecute those who planned, ordered and willingly executed said warcrimes.

attributes.action: Change to the Lifetime ISA rules (re: transferring from Help to Buy ISA)
attributes.background:
Allow Help to Buy savers who have 
- saved for over a year and 
- are going to transfer their savings into the Lifetime ISA on 06/04/2017 in order to purchase a home at over the £250,000 cap
be able to purchase a home at any point once the Lifetime ISA is open rather than wait another year.
attributes.additional_details:
"those who already have a Help to Buy: ISA will be able to transfer these funds into a Lifetime ISA and receive the government bonus on those savings...In line with the normal Lifetime ISA rules, Help to Buy: ISA savers will be able to purchase a first home with the government bonus 12 months from the date of opening their Lifetime ISA."

Source: https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/508176/Lifetime_ISA_final.pdf [Accessed 31/07/2016]

attributes.action: Introduce a National Childcare Service
attributes.background: A National Childcare Service (NCS) offering free universal childcare to all children from one to fourteen. The NCS would be funded through general taxation. Free universal childcare scares many. It will have a high cost in a time of austerity however the return will more than justify the outlay.
attributes.additional_details: A stable high-quality early childhood education and care system should be regarded as part of the infrastructure for the country's long-term economic and social development. What it requires is that government takes the longer view rather than a horizon that stretches only to the next election.

attributes.action: Revise self defence laws in the UK and bring back handgun ownership.
attributes.background: Enough people are dead in Europe and the time to act is upon us. GCHQ has done an amazing job at preventing terror attacks in the UK but the police cannot possibly act fast enough to save us all in case of attack by terror groups. We propose a government measure to allow civilians to keep handguns.
attributes.additional_details:
The five or six consecutive terror attacks in Europe prior to this date.

The brave US police officer who fought with the Orlando shooter to delay his spree and save hundreds.

A Switzerland style gun law attitude or Israel style will work. People in Europe are applying for gun permits in droves and can only use those guns to defend themselves at home and left defenceless in the streets.

attributes.action: Abolish A2 motorcycle licence and become fully un-restricted after 2 years
attributes.background: Back in 2013 the UK Government changed the laws on motorcycle licence having to take additional tests after being restricted for 2 years and having to fork out more money for for another mod1 and mod2 when it should go back to how it used to be and full unrestricted after 2 years automatically
attributes.additional_details:
16 cbt - 50 cc
17 cbt - 125cx now allowing 250 cc on L plates 
19 restricted licence 
21 derestricted license 
24 and above complete a direct access 

Remove the need for additional tests once passed restricted licence stay restricted for 2 years then automatically upgrade to full derestricted licence

attributes.action: Stop all DWP benefit payment sanctions immediately.
attributes.background:
It is basically unethical and unhealthy.
The UN agree - It confirmed that the British government’s austerity measures are indeed in breach of its obligations to the human rights of citizens living in B
attributes.additional_details:
THE United Nations committee on economic and cultural rights recently published a highly damning report.
It confirmed that the British government’s austerity measures are indeed in breach of its obligations to the human rights of citizens living in Britain.
The report considers a number of areas, all of which are drastically important to our everyday lives. . . . 
 foodbanks, unemployment rates, the housing crisis, mental health care and discrimination against migrants and disabled people.

attributes.action: Scrap the BBC and sell all assets for the NHS to save people £150 pa for life
attributes.background: The BBC has become an expensive white elephant with anything but a public service as its main goal. It is becoming extremely political and targeting minorities and politicians alike. It is time to make good use of its assets by selling it all and earmaking all proceeds to go to the NHS
attributes.additional_details:
The use of subliminal images by the BBC in targeting minorities or immigrants or even Scotland is disgusting. It has political agendas far beyond its remit and even targets politicians. Even if you do not like Jeremy Cobyn, one day it could be any other politician which does not serve the ultimate controller of the BBC.

The NHS which is depleted and suffering could make better use of these resources for the welfare of the nation. And people would be less taxed too by its excesses of the BBC.

attributes.action: Hold a Final EU Referendum
attributes.background:
A vote to Leave the EU on 23/6 was a false choice, for the terms of exit were unknown. Hold a Final EU Referendum giving electors a vote (transferable to second preference) from three clear choices:

• Leave with control of EU immigration
• Leave with EU single market access
• Remain in EU
attributes.additional_details:
The terms of a potential UK exit from the EU had not been addressed at the time of the 23 June 2016 referendum. Consequently, many who voted to Leave were not aware that the UK would have to choose between control of immigration from the EU and continued access to the EU single market. Leave voters are entitled to full disclosure of the necessary abandonment of one or the other of these core Leave aims. 

The electorate should be given the chance to express first and second  preferences from three choices: the two Leave alternatives and to Remain. Votes for the least favoured alternative would be transferred to second preferences.

This Final EU Referendum would provide the fairest and most democratic expression of public will to the government to guide its negotiations with the EU.

attributes.action: Changes to Protect 'Asthma' Sufferers from Smoke from Garden Fires, Clean Air.
attributes.background: Asthma sufferers need protecting from Smoke from Garden Fires in Law, in this day and age with Air pollution it can be a Killer for not only these but anyone who has a Lung and Breathing issue, Clean Air act does Not Protect these people at this time, they have a right to live and breath.
attributes.additional_details:
The Government talks on so called Clean Air but have Failed to look into these people and Protect them in Law, very wrong and selfish on their part as you have to have the issue to know, also Hay Fever another Lung issue from the same.

There are Recycling outlets to stop this and Must be used by All and Not the Few, Fires also cause issues with Wildlife and Nesting Birds which are Declining at a large rate.

Common sense must Prevail.

attributes.action: Make killing a cat or dog with a vehicle a criminal offence
attributes.background:
On Friday 13th of May my life was forever changed.
My much loved cat was run over and killed outside my house. I was on my way to work when my neighbour called to break the news. I had to come home and take my cat to be cremated the same day and was off work for a week as a result with stress.
attributes.additional_details: I reviewed my CCTV footage and can see only one car drive down my road from when the cat goes over the fence until someone clearly picks him up and places him on the pavement. the car in question can't be positively identified but was going at some speed and made no attempt to swerve, slow down or stop after the event. This attitude that family pets are not important enough to make a law to protect has bred this type of attitude and I for one think this is wrong and needs addressing

attributes.action: Introduce licenses for pet ownership
attributes.background: More and more pets are going missing as well as stolen. As well as this, dog fighting is still in existence. By introducing licenses we can reduce this and know that pets are in a safe home through the checks owners must go through to own any animal.
attributes.additional_details: I run a group on Facebook and everyday there are more missing pets. Dog fighting still exists and in a recent report it has stated dog fighting happened every day. Licenses will require the owner to pass simple knowledge and possibly even annual checks to be sure the pet is safe. This would work well with a register listing all animal abusers so they do not hurt an animal again as they wont have a license to buy pets. In addition stop the ban on the four dogs. With responsible owners these dogs do not need to be banned.

attributes.action: Don't implement GCSE exam 9-1 grades, instead have A*, A, B*, B, C*, C, D, E, F.
attributes.background: The justification for swapping from A*-G to 9-1 can be found on the gov.uk webpage in additional details. After reading it I hope you agree it will just serve to cause massive confusion for employers & students. The system I propose keeps the the new 9 grades but is comparable to existing ones.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.gov.uk/government/news/setting-standards-for-new-gcses-in-2017

http://www.theguardian.com/education/2015/jun/02/ofqual-survey-finds-wide-confusion-and-doubts-about-gcse-and-a-level-changes

https://www.tes.com/news/school-news/breaking-news/teachers-confused-over-new-numerical-gcse-grading-system

attributes.action: Make sanitary bins in male toilets compulsory for the transgender community.
attributes.background: I would like male toilets to have sanitation bins as the transgender community will be able to feel more comfortable and not have to use the female toilets if they are menstruating. This will promote self esteem among the transgender community.
attributes.additional_details: As gender neutral toilets are gradually coming into place, I believe it is very appropriate that the transgender community is made to feel as comfortable as they can be. The cost of the sanitation bins are very little and extremely convenient. The bins will be used if the trans* man is menstruating. He will then be able to use the male bathroom and feel comfortable doing so.

attributes.action: No general election until after Brexit
attributes.background: We call on the next Tory leader not to call a general election and concentrate on brexit and make the divorce from the EU smooth as possible

attributes.action: Require large companies to pay invoices within 30 days of invoice date.
attributes.background: Large companies impose onerous payment periods on small companies. Small companies are unable to resist because of their lack of power. This results in large companies using small companies as another source of funding.
attributes.additional_details: Recently, to add a further level of difficulty, the large companies have created a charge mechanism for invoices paid in a lesser time. It is quite common for large companies to pay smaller companies in periods of 90 - 120  days.

attributes.action: Form a National Unity negotiation team to immediately start negotiating with EU.
attributes.background: Post EU vote there is a vacuum and high uncertainty. We want to rapidly see the roadmap to clarity and then stability. The terms of our exit from the EU will last well beyond the term of this government. Therefore, a negotiating team reflecting many perspectives is required - a National Unity team.
attributes.additional_details: PM has resigned. His replacement's selection will take time. Shadow cabinet is fragmenting reducing the effective opposition. Scotland, N.Ireland and the young are bitter about the result. The break-up of the UK is a possibility. Markets are jittery. Now is the time for National Unity. Form our EU negotiation team quickly start the herculian task ahead. It should be led by Leave reflecting the people's will, but must be inclusive to reflect those in our society that feel alienated by the vote.

attributes.action: All pledges in democratic elections and referendums should be legally binding.
attributes.background: The recent EU referendum result is based upon a campaign of misinformation.  This is not democratic since the public are not being told the truth. All elections pledges should be clear and legally binding. Any politician found to be deliberately misleading the public should be convicted of fraud.

attributes.action: Give all teenagers aged under 18 on 23.6.16 a vote in a supplemental referendum.
attributes.background: Allowing teenagers to vote in a supplementary EU referendum will be good for the future of Britain’s democracy, because whatever the final outcome they will have had the opportunity to participate in the decision. Their votes can be added to the June ballot and the result recalculated.

attributes.action: Stop government invoking Article 50 until there is a deal in UK's interests.
attributes.background: Most MPs, who are well aware of their constituents interests, support remaining in the EU.  They are the appropriate people to judge if deal is in the U.K.'s interests.  MPs should have the power to to ensure their constituents interests are safeguarded before there is an exit from the EU.

attributes.action: Change the law to clarify election expenses and end the current controversy.
attributes.background:
The government should end the current controversy over allegations of electoral fraud by changing the law such that the rules are made unambiguous.
If the party in question apologises for the mistake and the affected members step down there should be no need for expensive investigations.
attributes.additional_details:
Either this issue stems from an honest mistake or it does not.
If it is an honest mistake then the only reasonable course of action is to own up and try to set it straight.
If it is not an honest mistake, then it appears to be a callous and calculated plot perpetrated by a corruption that runs through the heart of the party.

attributes.action: The Government to start an official trial on the safety of e-cig/vape products
attributes.background: I have been a vaper for 6 years and feel much better than when I was a smoker.  I have not even had a cold for 3 years which means no trips to the doctors or prescriptions!!
attributes.additional_details: Although there may be dodgy products on the market...this can equate to dodgy iPhone chargers.  Exploding batteries....ever heard of mobile phones exploding/setting on fire.  E-cigs/vaping products need to be officially tested and for the scare tactics to stop once and for all

attributes.action: Reform the House of Lords to become the revising chamber of devolved assemblies
attributes.background: To reform the House of Lords to become the revising chamber for every devolved Parliament and Assembly in the United Kingdom to promote good governance while reducing the future burden on the taxpayers of the Realm with unnecessary duplication across the nation.

attributes.action: Let all serving forces personnel grow a full beard.
attributes.background: Using the same guidelines as the Royal Navy, allow all serving personnel for all UK forces to grow and maintain a beard.

attributes.action: Introduce a charge for travellers to pay for cleaning up once they have moved on
attributes.background: Some travellers who break into land cause damage which they do not have to pay for. This is wrong and creates a system with no incentive to stop them doing it again.
attributes.additional_details:
Around where we live land has been damaged including the local football field. It costs money to get court orders and repair the damage. 

All the council’s costs involved could and should be used for local people instead of wasted due to a lack of punishment to deter this behaviour.

attributes.action: Free Commando Sergeant Alexander Blackman from jail
attributes.background: A soldier should never go to prison for killing the enemy in a battlefield situation. Sergeant Alexander Blackman was sent to prison for killing a member of the Taliban on a battlefield in Afghanistan. Commando Sergeant Alexander Blackman should not be in prison.

attributes.action: Free prescriptions for Students
attributes.background:
In a world where equal opportunity and equality are valued. I see it unfair that millions of students suffering from Mental Disabilities such as ADHD are required to pay for their prescriptions.

Students have limited funds and I feel that those funds should be spent on books, not their medication
attributes.additional_details:
Currently I myself have to pay for my medication, I pay £8.60 for my medication to help treat my ADHD. Paying for the tablets that put them on par with those not suffering from mental disabilities is something that millions of students are facing.
1 in 6 adults have a common mental disorder (CMD), and those of which who are students are occasionally, like myself, facing the choice; food or medication.
This is something I believe should be a thing of the past

attributes.action: Ban the use of zoos as a tourist attraction
attributes.background: Zoos set a limit on animal freedom, it is wrong that just because we are the dominant and most forward thinking species that we should capture and restraint the freedom of other animals for our own entertainment. I am petitioning to end animal captivity and give every animal the freedom it deserves.
attributes.additional_details: The world is developing at an extremely fast rate and traditions are not the only things fading out. It is estimated that 99% of all species that have lived on earth are now extinct, and over 150,000 become extinct every day. these animals have limited lives as it is, and it isn't right for us as a dominant and prosperous species to constrain the animals to a restricted life in a cage.

attributes.action: End the 'Special Relationship' with the USA in the event of a Trump presidency.
attributes.background: After 580,000 petitioned to ban his entry into the UK, Trump may become president. Our Special Relationship means the British people may be dragged into economic, political and military conflict by a hated man. In this time of vulnerability, the UK must distance itself from Trump's America.
attributes.additional_details: In a campaign mired in racism, xenophobia, extremism, and sexual assault, Donald Trump has outlined plans which, due to the US/UK 'Special Relationship', may endanger British citizens and interests. This includes nuclear proliferation in Korea and Japan, the abandonment of NATO, forcing Mexico to pay for a border wall, ground troops in Syria, torture, opposition to China, and potential war with Iran and North Korea. If Trump wins, the UK must take a stand against his administration.

attributes.action: Consider a second runway for Gatwick
attributes.background: Why allocate a 3rd runway to Heathrow when Gatwick will fund 2nd runway

attributes.action: Increase the bursary for training English teachers 2016-17
attributes.background:
The government are increasing the bursary for training English teachers from a minimum of £4,000 to £9,000 for all.
Many who are training to teach English this year will only receive £4,000 to cover living expenses. If they had applied this year they would receive over double the amount.
attributes.additional_details:
https://getintoteaching.education.gov.uk/funding-and-salary/overview

https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/561599/Initial_teacher_training_bursaries_funding_manual_2017_to_2018.pdf

attributes.action: Change the Bus Services Bill so authorities are allowed to set up bus companies.
attributes.background: We the undersigned object to section 21 (1) of the Bus Services Bill 2016 as it stops local authorities from having the freedom to form municipal bus companies and we want this clause erased from the final bill.
attributes.additional_details:
The bill can be viewed at http://www.publications.parliament.uk/pa/bills/lbill/2016-2017/0058/lbill_2016-20170058_en_1.htm

Authorities should have the ability to set up municipal bus companies. It is essential that councils have the power to best meet the transport needs of citizens, for example cities with Mayors should be allowed to follow the model laid out by Transport For London. 

Carefully considered, reliable and affordable public transport is essential to modern life.

attributes.action: Please don't wage another war in the ME after Iraq,Libya,Afghanistan now Syria!
attributes.background: Please send no troops, SAS special forces and clandestine operations into Syria. Unless Syria declares war on us, we shell stay neutral and not get involved in this war. We have our own country to care for. And we caused enough suffering and damage to the Middle East already. Please save the peace!
attributes.additional_details: The war on Iraq was based on a lie. The war on Libya caused death and suffering to the Libyan Nation and extreme damage to the security of Europe and the whole world. Yemen was bombed for many years by drones now by Saudis. Afghanistan is turning back into a unsafe war torn country under the rule of Taliban. Please save Syria and stay out of it. Let the Syrian Government and their Allies deal with their problem. Its not our Country. Not our war. We have a beautiful country to care for!

attributes.action: Allow freedom of movement to continue within the tech sector
attributes.background: The UK has a skills shortage when it comes to tech, and in order for us to remain the digital capital of Europe. We must allow talent to come easily into the UK. A complicated visa process will mean that talent goes elsewhere and we suffer as a result of it.

attributes.action: Tackle the pay gap between men and women.
attributes.background:
According to AAUW, the pay gap won’t close until 2152 - lets change that.
Why should women be paid 20% less than a man doing exactly the same job?
Please sign this petition and help us take one more step towards gender equality.

attributes.action: Require transport authorities to fund free concessionary fares for unpaid carers
attributes.background: Unpaid Carers (carers who do not provide care as a career) are a crucial part of society saving the government £162 billion every year. Travel is an essential service and yet, is a barrier that makes it harder for us to deal with our many responsibilities.
attributes.additional_details: Public transport is a service that is a need, we are an essential part of the community so why can't we use it too! Not everyone can get benefits so let's help carers get what they deserve, it may not seem important to most but to many it will change their lives. We deserve to be treated as equals...Is free/concessionary transport for carers to much to ask for in return for those who dedicate their lives to care for others?

attributes.action: Review extra funding for m60 ring road and m56 and other adjoining motorways
attributes.background: Traffic chaos all around m60 ring road ever y day adding as much as 2 hours on to the journey , major problems Include m56 junctions 3 to 1 heading East to m60 anticlockwise at junction 3 cheadle
attributes.additional_details: M56 narrows to 2 lanes to join m60 4lanes to 2 causes bottleneck and traffic increasing up to 500,000 annually , nationally
